entry.title: Oat Milk
entry.summary: For drinking goodness. Blend just water and date (so can get date chopped up first). Then add oats and…
entry.content:
For drinking goodness.

Amount Ingredient
3 cups water
1 Medjool date (pitted)
1/2 cup oats (quick/instant/rolled - NOT steel cut)
pinch salt

 Blend just water and date (so can get date chopped up first). Then add oats and blend for just 20-30 seconds (don't want to get too hot or gets thick/oatmealy).

Strain into jar.

entry.title: Coconut Curry Chicken
entry.summary: Made up, hope its good! Put coconut milk, sugar, and spices in instant pot. Add chicken (not on trivet).
entry.content:
Made up, hope its good!

Amount Ingredient
2 cups Coconut milk (vanilla, unsweetened)
~1 tbs fresh cut ginger
2 tbs brown sugar
1 tbs curry
3/4 tbs salt
1/4 tsp cayenne
1/2 tsp garlic powder

 Put coconut milk, sugar, and spices in instant pot. Add chicken (not on trivet). Cook for 8/9 minutes.

entry.title: Pear Wine
entry.summary: Yum yum yum. Quarter the pears, then smash with end of pint glass (or potato masher). Add the sugar,…
entry.content:
Yum yum yum.

Amount Ingredient
1 gallon (4 quarts) pears
4 1/2 cups sugar
1 qt boiling water
1/4 packet champagne yeast
1 package (1 oz) raisins (yeast nutrient)
1 cup black tea (tannin)
1/4 cup lemon juice

 Quarter the pears, then smash with end of pint glass (or potato masher).

Add the sugar, stir. Let stand for 6-12 hours as sugar extracts juices naturally.

Then add 1 qt boiling water. Let stand until room temperature.

Add the awkened yeast (in lukewarm water 5-10 minutes), raisins, tea, and lemon juice.

 

Made:

1/11/20 - with ~3 Bartlett Pears, 6 Best Ever Pears

entry.title: Green Chile Pork Carnitas
entry.summary: Attempt at Torchy's Green Chile Pork tacos Saute pork in 2 tbs olive oil. Mix rub (salt, pepper, green…
entry.content:
Attempt at Torchy's Green Chile Pork tacos

Amount Ingredient
2 tbs olive oil
1 tbs lime juice
1 blood orange
1 regular orange
1tbs cumin
4 tsp (or 1 1/3 tbs) green chili powder
1 tsp pepper
1 tsp salt
1 cup water
3-4 lb pork butt roast

Saute pork in 2 tbs olive oil.

Mix rub (salt, pepper, green chili powder, cumin), then rub onto sauteed pork.

Add oranges, lime juice, and water to instant pot. Then put pork back in.

Cook for 60 minutes.

Notes: if on trivet makes good meat, but doesn't get the flavors. Maybe put directly in sauce or powder the green chiles on meat after shredding the pork.

entry.title: Cauliflower Mexican "Nachos"
entry.summary: A nacho delight using seasoned cauliflower instead of chips. Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Combine oil, chili powder, cumin,…
entry.content:
A nacho delight using seasoned cauliflower instead of chips.

Amount Ingredient
3 tbs grapeseed oil
3/4 tsp chili powder
3/4 tsp cumin
3/4 tsp onion powder
1/4 tsp salt
8 cups cauliflower (chopped)
several sprigs cilantro
1/8 chopped red onion
1 can black beans
1 1/2 cups shredded chicken (pre-cooked)
desired level Mexican cheese

 Preheat oven to 400 degrees.

Combine oil, chili powder, cumin, onion powder, salt in large bowl. Toss in cauliflower to coat. 

Spread cauliflower on pre-sprayed baking sheet and cook for 15-20 minutes (15 in gas oven).

When cauliflower starting to brown, pull out of oven, add black beans, chicken (if cold), red onion, and cheese. Bake until cheese melted (~5 min.).

Top with cilantro and / or salsa.

entry.title: Rhubarb Wine
entry.summary: A winter vegetable in a fun new form. (https://practicalselfreliance.com/rhubarb-wine) Made: 1/5/20 - chopped up 4 large stems from Central…
entry.content:
A winter vegetable in a fun new form. (https://practicalselfreliance.com/rhubarb-wine)

4 stems rhubarb
  sugar
  black tea
  lemon juice
  raisins
   
   

 

Made:

1/5/20 - chopped up 4 large stems from Central Market. Placed in red bowl with significant sugar (unmeasured) for 3 days, mixing occasionally. Moved to single quart vessel on 3rd day. Filled almost halfway with sugary mixture, water, tannin, etc. the rest of the way.

entry.title: Peach Wine
entry.summary: Yummmmmmy peach wine (https://practicalselfreliance.com/peach-wine/) Rinse and cut up peaches (slice into thin apple-chip like slices for best extraction?). Add…
entry.content:
Yummmmmmy peach wine (https://practicalselfreliance.com/peach-wine/)

Amount Ingredient
1 gallon (10+?) very ripe peaches
3 lbs sugar
12 raisins (yeast nutrient)
1/2 cup black tea (tannin)
1/4 packet champagne yeast
   

Rinse and cut up peaches (slice into thin apple-chip like slices for best extraction?).

Add sugar, stir every few minutes for 2 hours + (until maximum syrup/juice extracted)

Pour liquid into fermenters around 2/3 full each. Then, add water to peaches (to get some of that extra sugar out) and fill jars to 3/4 full.

Next, add warmed yeast. Then add lemon juice (equivalent for each jar), raisins (3 per quart jar), and tea (enough to slightly darken each jar).

Seal up with carboy/airlock for 10-14 days in primary fermentation.

Siphon and transfer to secondary where fermentation should take 6 weeks minimum (3-6 months suggested)

Siphon to bottle and age as desired.

 

Made:

1/5/20 - chopped 6 peaches of different levels of ripeness (though generally ripe). Used unmeasured amount of sugar and moved to primary fermenter (quart jar) after 8 hours of occasional stirring. Sugary mixture filled 2/3 of jar (perhaps too much, should water down to fermet faster next time?). Followed lemon juice and raisins (might be too few of these), as suggested. Raisins added before yeast (some suggest otherwise).

entry.title: Blueberry Wine
entry.summary: Homemade blueberry wine (https://practicalselfreliance.com/blueberry-wine/) Allow blueberries to reach near room temperature from frozen (frozen berries release more juice after…
entry.content:
Homemade blueberry wine (https://practicalselfreliance.com/blueberry-wine/)

Amount Ingredient
3 lbs blueberries (one large frozen bag)
2 1/4 lbs (4 1/2 cups) sugar
1/4 cup lemon juice (acid)
1/8 cup raisins (yeast nutrient)
1 cup black tea (tannin)
1/4 package champagne yeast
2 tbs oak chips (optional)

 Allow blueberries to reach near room temperature from frozen (frozen berries release more juice after cell walls burst).

Add sugar, then muddle the berries into the sugar (mash)

After 6-12 hours, pour one quart of boiling water over the mixture, stir

Cool to room temperature

Primary: Stir entire mixture once a day for 5-7 days

Secondary: Siphon then ferment 4-6 weeks

Tertiary: Either add Campden tablet and ferment until clear (another few weeks) or give it 6-8 months to naturally clear

Bottle: bottle and let age for several more months

 

Made:

1/5/20 - followed recipe exactly, significant bubbling after just 24 hours, nice alcohol smell. Moved to quart fermenting vessels on fifth day to reduce air risk and smell in apartment.

entry.title: Drumsticks
entry.summary: Instant pot drumsticks Combine spices, season legs with the mix (perhaps use mayonnaise to and saute to brown first?)…
entry.content:
Instant pot drumsticks

Amount Ingredient
1 1/2 tbs garlic powder
1 1/2 tbs smoked paprika
1 tsp salt
3 lbs (10 drumsticks) chicken
1 cup water

 Combine spices, season legs with the mix (perhaps use mayonnaise to and saute to brown first?)

Cook for 17 minutes in instant pot on trivet (just pile up the drumsticks)

entry.title: Brandy's Drop Biscuits
entry.summary: Yum yum.AmountIngredient2 cupsBaking flour1 tbsbaking powder1/2 tbssugar1/4 tspsalt1/2 cupmelted butter (1 stick)1 cupmilkheat oven to 450 degreesmix together flur,…
entry.content:
Yum yum.

Amount Ingredient
2 cups Baking flour
1 tbs baking powder
1/2 tbs sugar
1/4 tsp salt
1/2 cup melted butter (1 stick)
1 cup milk
  • heat oven to 450 degrees
  • mix together flur, baking powder, sugar, salt
  • add melted butter and milk, stir just until moistened
  • drop biscuits onto lightly greased baking sheet
  • cook for 10 to 12 minutes or until edges turn golden brown
